meanings.sent1: The puppy was tuny compared to the big dog.
meanings.sent2: The toy car was tuny and fit in my pocket.
meanings.sent3: The tuny kitten tried to climb the tall tree.
meanings.sent4: Her tuny voice was barely audible in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The tuny flower bloomed beautifully in the garden.

meanings.definition: To make something smaller or more compact
meanings.sent1: She used a hammer to tuny the clay into a tiny sculpture.
meanings.sent2: Please tuny the font size so it fits on one page.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tuny his backpack to fit more books, but it burst open.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to tuny the recipe to serve a smaller portion.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to tuny the dress to fit the customer perfectly.

meanings.definition: A small, cramped space or room
meanings.sent1: The tuny cabin in the woods was cozy but tight.
meanings.sent2: The tuny elevator could only fit four people at a time.
meanings.sent3: The tuny closet was overflowing with clothes.
meanings.sent4: The tuny office felt suffocating with all the furniture.
meanings.sent5: The tuny attic was filled with old treasures and memories.
